caption: Table 1: Test accuracy with instance-dependent noise on CIFAR-10/100.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results of various methods on CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 datasets with different instance-dependent noise rates (IDN).  It compares the proposed TMR method against several baseline and state-of-the-art methods, showcasing the performance under varying levels of noise. The results highlight the effectiveness of TMR across different noise levels, demonstrating its superiority over other methods.

caption: Table 2: Test accuracy on CIFAR-10N and CIFAR-100N.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results on CIFAR-10N and CIFAR-100N datasets.  The results are shown for different noise types (Aggregate, Random 1-3, Worst) and compared against various baselines methods (CE, Forward, Co-teaching, ELR+, DivideMix, SOP+, PGDF) and the proposed TMR+ method.  The table highlights the performance of each method under different noise conditions.

caption: Table 3: Test accuracy on Clothing1M, Webvision and ILSVRC12.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results of different label noise learning methods on three real-world image datasets: Clothing1M, Webvision, and ILSVRC12.  The methods compared include several state-of-the-art techniques, and the results show the performance of each method under real-world noisy label conditions.

caption: Table 4: Ablation study of TMR, IR represents implicit regularization and TM represents transition matrix.
description: This table presents the ablation study of the proposed TMR method. It shows the impact of removing either the implicit regularization (IR) or the transition matrix (TM) component on the model's performance under different noise levels (IDN-0.2 and IDN-0.4) on CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 datasets.  The results demonstrate that both IR and TM are crucial components for the effectiveness of the TMR method.

caption: Table 1: Test accuracy with instance-dependent noise on CIFAR-10/100.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results of different label noise learning methods on CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 datasets under various instance-dependent noise rates (IDN).  The results show the average test accuracy and standard deviation across 5 independent runs for each method and noise level.  It allows comparison of the performance of the proposed TMR method against several baseline and state-of-the-art methods.

caption: Table 1: Test accuracy with instance-dependent noise on CIFAR-10/100.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results of different methods on CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 datasets with varying instance-dependent noise rates (IDN).  It compares the performance of the proposed TMR method against several baseline and state-of-the-art methods. The results are shown for different noise levels (10%, 20%, 30%, 40%, 50%).
